text: Draft - Malty sweet taste. A little salt taste as well. Nose is heavy on grain.
Draught at Hop City. Really solid kolsch with some lemon and hops and a light body.
Draft. Small white head atop crystal clear straw body. Aroma is medium sweet, bread, some spicy. Taste is medium sweet, bread, some spicy, light lager lemon. Light body, light acidity.
Good kolsch. Clear gold pour with white head. Aroma is malt and yeast. Taste follows nose. Good hot weather beer.

Pours a clear golden yellow on tap with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave moderate lace. Aroma and taste of clean pale malts with a hint of fruity clean yeast, mild hop presence. A solid kolsch, definitely something Id like to drink outside.
Nice, easy drinking kolsch. Amber pour with good head and lacing. Great barley profile and a little butter. Crisp finish with hint of tang. Tap at brewpub.

Poured from the tap into a pint glass. The appearance is a clear golden colored brew with a small white head. The aroma is full of malt and grain . The taste is malt driven with some bread flavoring on the back end. This is a good beer.
Golden pour. Grainy, a tad sweet, mild hops at the end. Fair enough for the style.

On tap @ Wrecking Bar. Golden colored beer with some white foam. Sort of grainy and estery on the nose...maybe even a hint of banana as well as some apple. Slight pear, too. The flavor is a bit more malt focused and has a light grassy hop character, some toast, and crackery malt. Still some ester qualities and a bit sweet, but overall not bad.

Great example of a Kolsch. Crystal clear yellow with large white pure white head. Very carbonated aroma of sweet light malts with a touch of hops. Flavor of light malts and super crisp with noble hop finish.

On tap at the brewpub. Yellow, clear, with a ring of foam. Smells bready, toasty, with a subtle fruit note. Taste is Pretty much the same, but with maybe the fruity sweetness is a bit more pronounced. Not bad.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear gold with a medium sized white head. Soft grain on the nose, crisp and sweet. Medium bodied, grainy and sweet, crisp and with a light citrus hint. Finishes with a touch of sweetness, malt and grain. Easy drinking.
A good kolsch is a great beer and this is a good kolsch. Wonderful peppery hops over a dry malt. Id totally stock this for football drinking if it were legal in this state.
Clean good pour, white head. Totally crisp and clean. No off flavors. Simple yet quite tasty. Good stuff.
A sweet beer with light hop and excellent mouthfeel for ABV. Excellent aroma of grain and honey sweetness. Thin fading head. Probably the best Kolsch Ive had in the US.
Tap shared by jheath99. Clear apple juice in color with no head. Aroma of earth and malts. Taste of malts and lots of carbonation. Its okay
Tap from Lazy Dog. Pours a transparent golden with almost no head. Aroma of malts and grass. Taste of super light malt and hops
Draft pours a nice clear yellow color with a nice white head. Aromas of bready malt, hay, slight yeast. A simple beer, but a very nice example of the style

Atlanta, Ga. - on tap at the brewpub. Light golden pour, a bit of murkiness, with a crisp snow white head, decent film of lacing. Aroma has a hint of vanilla with some buttery accents. Flavor is similar in fashion with the some honey sweetness thrown in for good measure. Buttery accents have a bit of nuttiness along with it. Crisp and quaffable is the mouthfeel. Very refreshing.
had a lot of these in Koeln and many try to get this delicate and light style right. This is a good example, perfume and light esters but a clean nice ale beneath. Only a tad thin.

Appearance: Nearly clear, gold body with a smallish, white head.

Smell: Strong top note of grain, like a just-opened malt sack. A little hinted sweetness, a little grape ester on deeper sniffs.

Taste: Sweetish, honeyish cereal maltiness. Lightly husky, crusty breadiness. A light spice, a sliver herb, and an altogether faint fruitiness. Modestly bitter. Drying finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium-low carbonation.

Overall: Decent enough, would prefer a livelier effervescence. Cant we go back to their 1st generation Kolsch?

Pours a nice clear yellow-amber with a fairly thick and fine-bubbled golden buff head. Malty aroma has an overtone of yeast. Sharp flavor has a malty core and notes of hay, yeast and hops plus a hint of pear. Smooth mouthfeel is fairly firm and fizzy. Not at all bad, ha ha.

UPDATED: OCT 1, 2015 Draft at the brewpub with linh, Scarlett and mom. Pours a clear golden body with light white lacing. Aroma is bright grass, light dank herb and clean sweet malt. Mouthfeel is crisp with a papery bitter hop, light sweet malt and faint spicy grass.
On tap at Bleu Pub. Dark golden pour with a small khaki head. Doughy, bready aroma and flavor, light and malty. Meh.
On tap at the pub. Comes in with a little more lemon than expected but nice. Hop profile is lots of fresh cut grass. Aroma is nice toasty grain light wheat bread.
Yellow pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma of flat papery malt. Flat papery malt with a hinto sweet and a light papery bitter finish. Light bodied with good carbonation.
